newsitem.title: MEXICO: Sonia Furio, Spanish-Mexican actress, dies at 60.
newsitem.headline: Sonia Furio, Spanish-Mexican actress, dies at 60.

text.p: Sonia Furio, a Spanish-Mexican actress who appeared in more than 50 films, died on Sunday of pneumonia in Cuernavaca, Mexico, the Mexican news programme 24 Hours said late on Monday. She was 59 years old.
"I knew her practically since she arrived in Mexico. She was a good an beautiful woman," veteran news anchor Jacobo Zabludovsky said in eulogising her on the air.
Born to Spanish parents on July 30, 1937, Maria Sonia Furio Flores moved to Mexico at an early age and later took Mexican citizenship.
She landed her first Mexican movie role at age 17 in "And Tomorrow They Will Be Women," and had a starring role in most of her more than 50 films, Zabludovsky said.
In recent years she played roles on Mexican television soap operas.
In 1987 the National Association of Actors awarded her a medal for her long and distinguished career as a actress, 24 Hours said.
